label: Kitchen Display System (KDS) Optimization
description: AI-powered order routing and priority management reducing average ticket time by 25-40% and improving order accuracy to 99%+ through intelligent kitchen orchestration.

traditional.workflow: 1. Orders print on paper tickets in chronological sequence. 2. Kitchen manager manually assigns tickets to stations (grill, fry, assembly). 3. Orders prepared strictly in order received (FIFO) regardless of complexity. 4. Simple orders wait behind complex orders (1 burger waits for 10-item catering order). 5. Paper tickets lost, illegible, or out of sequence create errors.
constraints: FIFO processing creates uneven wait times (simple orders delayed)
Manual routing to stations inefficient
Paper tickets lost or illegible (3-5% error rate)
No visibility into station capacity or bottlenecks
Average ticket time 8-12 minutes
Kitchen manager overwhelmed during peak (routing burden)

agentic.workflow: 1. Intelligent Routing Agent analyzes incoming orders and auto-routes items to optimal stations based on current workload. 2. Priority Engine resequences orders: simple 1-item orders fast-tracked, complex orders batched efficiently. 3. Load Balancing Agent distributes work across grill, fry, and assembly stations to prevent bottlenecks. 4. Real-Time KDS displays color-coded order status: green <3 min, yellow 3-6 min, red >6 min (urgency signals). 5. Assembly Coordination Agent ensures all items for an order ready simultaneously (no cold fries waiting for burger).
dataSources: Incoming order queue and item details
Prep time by item and station
Order priority (dine-in vs delivery vs drive-thru)
benefits: 25-40% reduction in average ticket time (5-7 min vs 8-12 min)
Intelligent routing eliminates kitchen manager bottleneck
Fast-track simple orders improve customer satisfaction
Load balancing prevents station idle time
Coordinated assembly ensures hot, fresh food

quickWins: Deploy KDS at grill and fry stations

label: Order Routing & Load Balancing
description: Dynamic work distribution across kitchen stations increasing throughput 30-50% and reducing station idle time by 60-80% through optimal resource allocation.

traditional.workflow: 1. All burger orders go to primary grill station even if secondary grill is idle. 2. Kitchen manager notices backup at grill, manually tells staff to use secondary grill. 3. No visibility into which stations are overloaded vs idle. 4. Fry station idle while grill is overwhelmed (unbalanced workload). 5. Peak hour chaos with manager shouting instructions.
constraints: Manual load balancing slow and reactive
Station utilization uneven (some overloaded, some idle)
No real-time visibility into station capacity
30-40% station idle time during peak (capacity wasted)
Kitchen manager overwhelmed coordinating work
Throughput limited by bottleneck stations

agentic.workflow: 1. Load Monitoring Agent tracks real-time capacity at each station: grill at 90%, fry at 40%, assembly at 70%. 2. Dynamic Routing directs incoming burger order to secondary grill (idle capacity) instead of overloaded primary grill. 3. Cross-Training Optimizer suggests station reassignments: 'Move Sarah from fry to assembly (fry has excess capacity)'. 4. Predictive Demand Agent forecasts next 15 min workload and pre-positions staff. 5. Bottleneck Alert notifies manager of emerging constraints before backup occurs.
dataSources: Real-time station workload and queue depth

quickWins: Enable automatic routing to secondary stations when primary >80% capacity

label: Preparation Time Prediction
description: ML-based prep time forecasting with 90-95% accuracy enabling precise customer promises and reducing wait time complaints by 50-70% through realistic expectations.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer places order and system says '10-15 minutes' for all orders regardless of complexity. 2. Simple burger takes 5 minutes, customer annoyed by overpromise. 3. Complex 20-item order takes 25 minutes, customer frustrated by underpromise. 4. No adjustment for current kitchen workload or peak hours. 5. 40-50% of time estimates inaccurate, damaging trust.
constraints: Static time estimates ignore order complexity
No adjustment for current kitchen load
40-50% inaccuracy rate damages customer trust
Overpromising creates negative surprise
Underpromising creates anxiety and abandonment
Peak hour estimates wildly inaccurate

agentic.workflow: 1. Prep Time Prediction Agent analyzes order: 1 burger (3 min) + 2 sides (4 min) + shake (2 min) = 6 min total (parallel prep). 2. Kitchen Load Adjuster adds current queue delay: 4 orders ahead averaging 4 min each = +5 min. 3. Staff Availability Factor adjusts for current staffing: lunch rush with full crew = no delay, mid-afternoon short-staffed = +2 min. 4. Real-Time Update adjusts estimate as order progresses: 'Your order is ahead of schedule, ready in 3 min instead of 8'. 5. Accuracy Tracking learns from actual completion times to refine future predictions.
dataSources: Historical prep times by item and complexity
Staff count and skill levels on shift
Day of week and time of day patterns
Order completion time actual vs predicted
Drive-thru vs dine-in vs delivery channel
benefits: Accurate promises build trust and loyalty

quickWins: Deploy ML model for top 20 menu items
Add real-time order tracking with updates

label: Inventory Par Level Management
description: Automated inventory monitoring with predictive replenishment reducing stockouts by 80-90% and waste by 30-50% through intelligent demand forecasting.

traditional.workflow: 1. Kitchen staff manually checks inventory levels during shift. 2. Staff estimates remaining portions: 'We have about 20 patties left'. 3. Manager decides when to prep more based on gut feel. 4. Chicken nuggets run out during dinner rush (stockout). 5. Over-prepped fries discarded at end of shift (waste).
constraints: Manual inventory checks time-consuming and inaccurate
Stockouts during peak hours (10-15% of shifts)
Over-production leads to 20-30% waste
No predictive replenishment (reactive prep)
Par levels set quarterly, don't adapt to demand changes
Staff distracted from cooking to monitor inventory

agentic.workflow: 1. Inventory Tracking Agent monitors real-time usage: 12 Big Macs sold in last 30 min, 8 patties remaining. 2. Demand Forecasting predicts next hour needs: lunch rush forecasts 25 Big Mac orders, need to prep 20 more patties. 3. Replenishment Alert notifies staff: 'Prep 20 beef patties now for lunch demand'. 4. Par Level Optimization dynamically adjusts mins based on daypart: breakfast needs 10 egg patties, dinner needs 50 beef patties. 5. Waste Prevention Agent alerts before over-production: 'Only prep 10 fries, low demand expected last 2 hours'.
dataSources: Real-time sales by item from POS
Day of week and seasonal trends
Weather impact on demand (hot day = more drinks)
Hold time and shelf life by item
benefits: Dynamic par levels adapt to actual demand
Labor efficiency (automated monitoring vs manual checks)

quickWins: Deploy inventory sensors for top 10 high-velocity items
prerequisites: Inventory tracking sensors or manual input

label: Food Safety Monitoring (Time, Temp)
description: Automated time and temperature tracking with real-time alerts preventing 95%+ food safety violations and ensuring regulatory compliance through continuous monitoring.

traditional.workflow: 1. Staff manually checks fridge temperature with thermometer every 4 hours. 2. Staff records temperature on paper log (often forgotten or faked). 3. Cooked food hold times tracked with manual timers and sticky notes. 4. Food held beyond safe time limits served to customers (potential illness). 5. Health inspector finds violations in paper logs (fines, closure risk).
constraints: Manual checks every 4 hours miss temperature excursions
Paper logs unreliable (forgotten, backdated, fabricated)
Hold time violations common (15-20% of shifts)
No real-time alerts for unsafe conditions
Health code violations risk fines ($500-$5000) or closure
Foodborne illness liability and reputation damage

agentic.workflow: 1. IoT Temperature Sensors continuously monitor fridges, freezers, hot holding units every 2 minutes. 2. Alert Agent immediately notifies manager if temp falls below 40°F (fridge) or 140°F (hot holding). 3. Hold Time Tracker starts timer when food placed in hot holding, alerts at 3.5 hours (before 4-hour limit). 4. Automatic Discard triggers at 4-hour limit: 'Discard chicken nuggets from batch #447 - hold time exceeded'. 5. Digital Compliance Log auto-generates audit trail for health inspectors with timestamps and corrective actions.
dataSources: Real-time temperature readings from all equipment
Hold time start timestamps by batch
benefits: Immediate alerts (2 min) vs 4-hour manual checks
Digital compliance logs for health inspectors
Automatic discard prevents serving unsafe food

hitlGate.threshold: Food hold time reaches 4-hour safety limit
hitlGate.policy: Require manager confirmation before automatic discard, or auto-discard if manager unavailable within 5 minutes

quickWins: Deploy IoT temp sensors in all fridges and hot holding units
Implement hold time alerts at 3.5 hours

label: Waste Tracking & Reduction
description: AI-powered waste analytics with root cause identification reducing food waste by 40-60% and saving $15K-$30K annually per location through targeted interventions.

traditional.workflow: 1. Staff discards expired or excess food at end of shift. 2. Manager estimates waste: 'We threw out about $50 of food today'. 3. No tracking of what items, why discarded, or trends over time. 4. Same over-production mistakes repeated daily. 5. 3-5% food cost waste accepted as normal.
constraints: No waste tracking or accountability
Unknown root causes (over-prep, expiration, quality issues)
3-5% food cost waste ($15K-$40K/year per location)
Repeated mistakes due to no feedback loop
Manager unaware of high-waste items or patterns
Environmental impact (landfill, sustainability goals)

agentic.workflow: 1. Waste Tracking Agent requires staff to scan/log all discarded items: reason (expired, overcooked, quality, customer mistake). 2. Analytics Engine identifies patterns: 'Fries waste peaks at 2pm daily (over-prepping for lunch rush)'. 3. Root Cause Agent surfaces top issues: 25% of waste from hold time expiration, 30% from over-production, 20% from prep errors. 4. Intervention Recommendations suggest fixes: 'Reduce fry batch size by 30% at 1:30pm', 'Retrain evening crew on burger cooking temps'. 5. Waste Reduction Tracker measures improvement: waste reduced from 4.2% to 2.1% over 3 months ($20K annual savings).
dataSources: Waste patterns by daypart and day of week
benefits: Root cause identification enables corrective action

quickWins: Implement waste logging app for end-of-shift discards
Generate weekly waste reports by item and reason

label: Recipe & Prep Guidance
description: Interactive digital prep guides with video tutorials reducing training time by 50-70% and improving consistency to 98%+ through standardized procedures.

traditional.workflow: 1. New hire shadows experienced crew member to learn prep tasks. 2. Verbal instructions: 'Put this much lettuce and these toppings on the burger'. 3. No standardized measurements or procedures (quality inconsistent). 4. Binder with laminated recipe cards rarely referenced. 5. New menu items require in-person training (slow rollout).
constraints: Training inconsistent (depends on trainer skill)
2-3 weeks to fully train new kitchen staff
Quality variance across shifts and locations
Recipe cards outdated or ignored
New menu rollouts require mass retraining
No visual guidance for complex prep

agentic.workflow: 1. Digital Recipe Guide displays step-by-step instructions on KDS or tablet: 'Step 1: Place bottom bun. Step 2: Add 1 patty. Step 3: Add 2 slices pickles...'. 2. Video Tutorial shows proper technique for complex tasks: how to fold burrito, proper portioning. 3. Interactive Checklist ensures all steps completed: checkmarks for each ingredient added. 4. Quality Photo shows finished product for visual comparison. 5. Real-Time Update pushes new recipes or modifications instantly to all locations.
dataSources: Menu updates and new item rollouts
benefits: 50-70% training time reduction (3-5 days vs 2-3 weeks)
98%+ recipe consistency across all shifts and locations
Visual guidance improves quality and reduces errors

quickWins: Deploy digital recipe guides on KDS for top 10 items
Create video tutorials for complex prep tasks
